abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Tongbai Pumped Storage Project, which operates a pumping
            station and sub-stations to regulate peak energy demand,
            provide emergency service, and ensure the safe operation of
            the East China Power Grid. Possible negative impacts caused
            by project construction will be offset by the following
            countermeasures: The unstable slope caused by the large
            variation in the water level of the upper and lower
            reservoirs will be closely monitored. A flood releasing
            tunnel built will be set up and people alerted when the
            reservoir is being discharged. Project affected persons will
            be resettled locally and the land resources available per
            capita will be minimally changed. To offset negative impacts
            to the ecological environment in the resettlement host area,
            the area will be afforested and protected as a bamboo, tea,
            and fruit tree zone to attract tourists. A wastewater
            discharge plan will alleviate the impact of sewage discharge
            on water quality. Artificial watering will control quarry
            construction and road pavement dust. Vehicle washing in the
            area of the lower reservoir will avoid water pollution in
            the area of the upper reservoir. Waste oil will be burned or
            shipped away; and wastewater from mechanical equipment will
            be centrally treated before discharge. Sewage will be
            diverted to septic tanks, and the manure used as fertilizer,
            while dining hall sewage will be discharged through an
            oil-separation pool. Drinking water will be sterilized.
